1.verse: In the beginning was the Word. And the Word was with God. And the Word was God.

2.verse: The same was in the beginning with God.

3.verse: All things were made by Him, and without Him was not anything made that was made.

4.verse: In Him was life. And that life was the Light of man.

5.verse: And the Light shines in the darkness. And the darkness has not understood it.

6.verse: There was a man sent from God whose name was John.

7.verse: One who came for a witness, to testify about the Light; so that through him all might believe.

8.verse: He was not the Light, but bore witness of the Light;

9.verse: that is, the true Light, which, coming into the world, lights all mankind.

10.verse: He was in the world, and the world was made by Him, and the world knew Him not.

11.verse: He came to His own, and His own received Him not.

12.verse: But as many as received Him, to them He gave power to be children of God, to those who believe in His Name,

13.verse: who are born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

14.verse: And the Word was made flesh and dwelt among us. And we saw the glory of Him, as the glory of the Only Begotten One of the Father, full of grace and truth.

15.verse: John bore witness of him, and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me, is in front of me. For He was before me.’”

16.verse: And of His fullness we have all received, and grace for grace.

17.verse: For the Law was given by Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

18.verse: No one has yet seen God at any time. The Only Begotten Son, Who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared him.

19.verse: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”

20.verse: And he confessed and did not deny, but said plainly, “I am not the Christ.”

21.verse: And they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” And he said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”

22.verse: Then they said to him, “Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”

23.verse: He said, “I am the voice of him that cries in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord’, as said the Prophet Isaiah.”

24.verse: Now those who were sent were from the Pharisees.

25.verse: And they asked him, and said to him, “Why do you baptize, then, if you are neither the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”

26.verse: John answered them, saying, “I baptize with water. But there is One among you whom you know not.

27.verse: It is He who comes after me, Who was before me, Whose sandal straps I am not worthy to unloose.”

28.verse: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John baptized.

29.verse: The next day John saw Jesus coming to him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, Who takes away the sin of the world!

30.verse: “This is He of Whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man Who is in front of me. For He was before me.

31.verse: And I knew Him not. But that He may be declared to Israel, I have come, baptizing with water.”

32.verse: So John bore witness, saying, “I have seen the Spirit come down from Heaven like a dove, and it stayed upon Him.

33.verse: And I knew Him not. But He who sent me to baptize with water, He said to me, ‘Upon Whom you shall see the Spirit coming down and staying, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Ghost.’

34.verse: And I have seen and testified that this is the Son of God.”

35.verse: The next day, John stood again, along with two of his disciples.

36.verse: And he saw Jesus walking by, and said, “Behold the Lamb of God!”

37.verse: And the two disciples heard him speak and followed Jesus.

38.verse: Then Jesus turned around, and saw them follow, and said to them, “What do you seek?” And they said to Him, “Rabbi, (which is to say by interpretation, ‘Master’) where are You staying?”

39.verse: He said to them, “Come, and see.” They came and saw where He dwelt and stayed with Him that day. For it was about the tenth hour.

40.verse: Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of the two who had heard John and followed him.

41.verse: He found his brother Simon first, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (Who is by interpretation, the Christ)

42.verse: And he brought him to Jesus. And Jesus looked at him, and said, “You are Simon, the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas.” (which is by interpretation, Rock)

43.verse: The following day, Jesus wished to go into Galilee. And He found Philip, and said to him, “Follow me.”

44.verse: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

45.verse: Philip found Nathanael, and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses wrote in the Law and the Prophets – Jesus of Nazareth, son of Joseph!”

46.verse: Then Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come, and see.”

47.verse: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and said of him, “Behold, indeed an Israelite in whom there is no deceit.”

48.verse: Nathanael said to Him, “From where do You know me? Jesus answered, and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

49.verse: Nathanael answered, and said to Him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”

50.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree’, you believe? You shall see greater things than these.”

51.verse: And He said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, hereafter you shall see Heaven open, and the Angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”

1.verse: And on the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. And the mother of Jesus was there.

2.verse: And Jesus was also invited, with His disciples, to the marriage.

3.verse: And when they ran out of wine, the mother of Jesus said to him, “They have no wine.”

4.verse: And Jesus said to her, “Woman, what is that to us? My hour has not yet come.”

5.verse: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”

6.verse: Now there were set there, six water pots of stone, for the purifying of the Jews, containing 20 to 30 gallons apiece.

7.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Fill the water pots with water.” Then they filled them up to the brim.

8.verse: Then He said to them, “Draw from them now, and take it to the master of the feast.” So, they brought it.

9.verse: Now when the master of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, (for he did not know where it came from; but the servants who drew the water knew) the master of the feast called the bridegroom,

10.verse: and said to him, “All men at the beginning set out good wine; and when all have drunk freely, then that which is worse. But you have withheld the good wine until now!”

11.verse: Jesus did this beginning of miracles in Cana of Galilee and showed forth His glory. And His disciples believed in him.

12.verse: After that, He went down into Capernaum, He and his mother, and His brothers, and His disciples. And they did not stay there long.

13.verse: For the Jews’ Passover was at hand. Therefore, Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

14.verse: And He found in the Temple those who sold oxen, and sheep, and doves. And moneychangers were sitting there.

15.verse: Then He made a whip of small cords and drove them all out of the Temple, with the sheep and oxen; and poured out the changers’ money; and overthrew their tables.

16.verse: And He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things away! Do not make My father’s house a house of merchandise!”

17.verse: And His disciples remembered that it was written, “The zeal of Your house has devoured me.”

18.verse: Then answered the Jews, and said to Him, “What sign do You show us saying You may do these things?

19.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, “Destroy this Temple, and in three days I will raise it up again.”

20.verse: Then the Jews said, “Forty-six years it took to build this Temple, and You will raise it up in three days?”

21.verse: But He spoke of the temple of His body.

22.verse: Therefore, as soon as He was risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them. And they believed the Scriptures, and the word which Jesus had said.

23.verse: Now when He was at Jerusalem, at the Passover, at the feast, many believed in His Name when they saw the miracles which He did.

24.verse: But Jesus did not entrust Himself to them, because He knew all,

25.verse: and had no need for anyone to testify concerning man. He knew what was in a man.

1.verse: There was now a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus - a ruler of the Jews.

2.verse: This man came to Jesus by night, and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher from God; for no one could do these miracles that You do, except God were with Him.”

3.verse: Jesus answered and said to him, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless one is born again, he cannot see the Kingdom of God.”

4.verse: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born who is old? Can he enter into his mother’s womb again, and be born?”

5.verse: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless one is born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the Kingdom of God.

6.verse: “That which is born of the flesh, is flesh. And that which is born of the Spirit, is spirit.

7.verse: “Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’

8.verse: “The wind blows where it will, and you hear the sound thereof, but cannot tell from where it comes, and where it goes. So is every man who is born of the Spirit.”

9.verse: Nicodemus answered, and said to Him, “How can these things be?”

10.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, “Are you a teacher of Israel, and know not these things?

11.verse: “Truly, truly, I say to you, we speak that we know, and testify that we have seen. But you do not receive our witness.

12.verse: “If when I tell you earthly things you do not believe, how shall you believe if I tell you of Heavenly things?

13.verse: “For no one ascends up to Heaven, except he who descended from Heaven – the Son of man, who is in Heaven.

14.verse: “And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up;

15.verse: “that whoever believes in Him, should not perish, but have eternal life.

16.verse: “For God so loves the world, that He has given His only begotten Son; that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have everlasting life.

17.verse: “For God did not send his Son into the world that He should condemn the world, but that the world, through Him, might be saved.

18.verse: “The one who believes in Him is not condemned. But the one who does not believe, is condemned already, because he has not believed in the Name of the only begotten Son of God.

19.verse: “And this is the judgment: that the light came into the world, and men loved darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.

20.verse: “For everyone who does evil hates the light, and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed.

21.verse: “But the one who practices truth comes to the light, that his works done according to God might be made visible.”

22.verse: After these things, Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea and stayed there with them and baptized.

23.verse: And John also baptized in Aenon, near Salim, because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized.

24.verse: For John was not yet cast into prison.

25.verse: Then there arose a question between John’s disciples and the Jews about purification.

26.verse: And they came to John, and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond Jordan, to whom you have borne witness, behold, he baptizes, and all come to him.”

27.verse: John answered, and said, “A man can receive nothing, except it be given to him from Heaven.

28.verse: You yourselves are my witnesses, that I said, ‘I am not that Christ, but that I am sent before Him.’

29.verse: “The One who has the bride is the Bridegroom. But the friend of the Bridegroom who stands and hears Him, rejoices greatly because of the Bridegroom’s voice. Therefore, my joy is fulfilled.

30.verse: “He must increase, but I must decrease.

31.verse: “The One who has come from on high is above all. The One who is from the earth, is from the earth, and speaks from the earth. The One who has come from Heaven is above all.

32.verse: “And what He has seen and heard, that He testifies. But no one receives His testimony.

33.verse: “The one who has received His testimony, has sealed that God is true.

34.verse: “For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God. For God does not give the Spirit by measure.

35.verse: “The Father loves the Son and has given all things into His hand.

36.verse: “The one who believes in the Son has everlasting life. And the one who does not obey the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.”

1.verse: Now, when the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

2.verse: (though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples),

3.verse: He left Judea and departed again into Galilee.

4.verse: And it was necessary for Him to go through Samaria.

5.verse: Then He came to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near the place that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph.

6.verse: And Jacob’s Well was there. Jesus then, wearied by the journey, sat upon the Well. It was about the sixth hour.

7.verse: There came a woman of Samaria to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me drink.”

8.verse: For His disciples had gone into the city to buy food.

9.verse: Then said the woman of Samaria to Him, “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask me for drink, who is a woman of Samaria? For the Jews do not associate with the Samaritans.”

10.verse: Jesus answered and said to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and Who it is who says to you, ‘Give me drink’, you would have asked of Him, and He would have given you water of life.”

11.verse: The woman said to Him, “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the Well is deep. From where then have You the water of life?

12.verse: Are You greater than our father, Jacob, who gave us the Well; and he himself drank thereof, and his sons, and his cattle?”

13.verse: Jesus answered, and said to her, “Whoever drinks of this water, shall thirst again.

14.verse: “But whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him, shall never thirst. But the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water, springing up into everlasting life.”

15.verse: The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me of that water, that I may never thirst, nor come here to draw again.”

16.verse: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come back.”

17.verse: The woman answered, and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You have well said, ‘I have no husband.’

18.verse: For you have had five husbands, and he whom you now have is not your husband. That you said truly.”

19.verse: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I see that You are a Prophet.

20.verse: “Our fathers worshiped on this mountain. And You say that Jerusalem is the place wherein it is necessary to worship.”

21.verse: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me. The hour comes when you shall neither on this mountain, nor at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

22.verse: “You worship that which you do not know. We worship that which we know. For salvation is from the Jews.

23.verse: “But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshipers shall worship the Father in Spirit and Truth. For the Father requires even such to worship Him.

24.verse: “God is a Spirit. And those who worship Him must worship Him in Spirit and Truth.”

25.verse: The woman said to Him, “I know well that Messiah shall come, Who is called Christ. When He has come, He will tell us all things.”

26.verse: Jesus said to her, “I am He, Who speaks to you.”

27.verse: And upon this came His disciples, and marveled that He talked with a woman. Yet no one said to Him, “What do You seek?” or “Why are You talking with her?”

28.verse: The woman then left her water pot, and went her way into the city, and said to the men,

29.verse: “Come! See a Man who has told me all things that ever I did! Can this be the Christ?”

30.verse: Then they went out of the city and came to Him.

31.verse: Meanwhile, the disciples urged Him, saying, “Master, eat.”

32.verse: But He said to them, “I have food to eat that you know not of.”

33.verse: Then the disciples said between themselves, “Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?”

34.verse: Jesus said to them, “My food is that I may do the will of Him who sent Me and finish His work.

35.verse: “Do you not say, ‘There are yet four months, and then comes harvest?’ Behold, I say to you lift up your eyes and look at the fields. For they are white toward harvest already.

36.verse: “And the one who reaps, receives reward, and gathers fruit to life eternal; that both the one who sows and the one who reaps might rejoice together.

37.verse: “For herein is the true saying: that one sows and another reaps.

38.verse: “I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored. Other men labored, and you have entered into their labors.”

39.verse: Now many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the saying of the woman who testified, “He has told me all things that ever I did.”

40.verse: Then, when the Samaritans came to Him, they urged Him to stay with them. And He stayed there two days.

41.verse: And many more believed because of His word.

42.verse: And they said to the woman, “Now we believe; not because of your saying, but because we have heard Him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”

43.verse: So, two days later He departed from there and went into Galilee.

44.verse: For Jesus Himself had testified that a Prophet has no honor in his own country.

45.verse: Then when He had come into Galilee, the Galileans who had seen all the things He did at Jerusalem, at the feast, received Him. For they also went to the feast.

46.verse: And Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where He had made wine from water. And there was a certain ruler, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

47.verse: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him, and urged Him to go down and heal his son. For he was about to die.

48.verse: Then said Jesus to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.”

49.verse: The ruler said to Him, “Sir, go down before my son dies.”

50.verse: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son lives.” And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken to him and went his way.

51.verse: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, saying, “Your son lives!”

52.verse: Then he inquired of them the hour when he began to feel better. And they said to him, “Yesterday, the seventh hour, the fever left him.”

53.verse: Then the father knew that it was the same hour in which Jesus had said to him, “Your son lives.” And he believed, and all his household.

54.verse: This, again, is the second miracle Jesus did after He had come out of Judea into Galilee.

1.verse: After that, there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went to Jerusalem.

2.verse: And there is at Jerusalem, by the sheep gate, a pool called in Hebrew, ‘Bethesda’, having five porches,

3.verse: In these lay a great multitude of sick folk; of blind, lame, and withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

4.verse: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool and stirred the water. Whoever then first stepped in, after the stirring of the water, was made whole of whatever disease he had.

5.verse: And a certain man was there who had been diseased 38 years.

6.verse: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had now been diseased a long time, He said to him, “Will you be made whole?”

7.verse: The sick one answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred. But while I am coming, another steps down before me.”

8.verse: Jesus said to him, “Rise. Take up your bed and walk.”

9.verse: And immediately the man was made whole. And he took up his bed and walked. And the same day was the Sabbath.

10.verse: Therefore, the Jews said to him who was made whole, “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”

11.verse: He answered them, “The One who made me whole, He said to me, ‘Take up your bed and walk.’”

12.verse: Then they asked him, “What Man is that who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”

13.verse: And the one who was healed did not know Who it was. For Jesus had withdrawn from the multitude that was in that place.

14.verse: And after that, Jesus found him in the Temple, and said to him, “Behold, you are made whole. Sin no more, lest a worse thing happen to you.”

15.verse: The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus Who had made him whole.

16.verse: And therefore the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath.

17.verse: But Jesus answered them, “My father has been working until now, and I work.”

18.verse: Therefore, the Jews sought to kill Him even more, not only because He had broken the Sabbath, but also because He said that God was his Father. And He made himself equal with God.

19.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you. The Son can do nothing of Himself, except that He sees the Father do. For whatever things He does, the same things the Son also does in like manner.

20.verse: “For the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things, whatever He Himself does. And He will show Him greater works than these, that you may marvel.

21.verse: “For just as the Father raises up the dead, and quickens them, so the Son quickens whom He will.

22.verse: “For the Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son,

23.verse: “that all should honor the Son as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son, the same does not honor the Father Who has sent Him.

24.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, the one who hears My word, and believes Him who sent Me, has everlasting life, and shall not come into judgment, but has passed from death to life.

25.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, the hour shall come, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God. And those who hear it shall live.

26.verse: “For as the Father has life in Himself, so likewise has He given to the Son, to have life in Himself.

27.verse: “And has also given Him power to execute judgment, in that He is the Son of man.

28.verse: “Do not marvel at this. For the hour shall come in which all who are in the graves shall hear His voice.

29.verse: “And those who have done good shall come forth to the resurrection of life; but those who have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment.

30.verse: “I can do nothing of My own Self. As I hear, I judge. And My judgment is just, because I seek not My own will, but the will of the Father Who has sent Me.

31.verse: “If I should bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true.

32.verse: “There is Another that bears witness of Me. And I know that the witness which He bears of Me is true.

33.verse: “You sent to John, and he bore witness to the truth.

34.verse: “But I do not receive the testimony of man. Nevertheless, these things I say that you might be saved.

35.verse: “He was a burning and shining lamp. And you were, for a season, willing to rejoice in his light.

36.verse: “But I have greater witness than the witness of John. For the works which the Father has given Me to finish (the same works that I do) bear witness of Me, that the Father sent Me.

37.verse: “And the Father himself, Who has sent Me, bears witness of Me. You have not heard His voice at any time, nor have you seen His shape.

38.verse: “And His word you do not have abiding in you. For Whom He has sent, Him you did not believe.

39.verse: “You search the Scriptures. For in them you think to have eternal life. And they are they which testify of Me.

40.verse: “But you will not come to Me, that you might have life.

41.verse: “I do not receive the praise of men.

42.verse: “But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you.

43.verse: “I have come in My Father’s Name, and you do not receive Me. If another shall come in his own name, you will receive him.

44.verse: How can you believe, when you receive honor one from one another, and do not seek the honor that comes from God alone?

45.verse: “Do not think that I will accuse you to My Father. There is one who accuses you - Moses, in whom you trust.

46.verse: “For had you believed Moses you would have believed Me. For he wrote of Me.

47.verse: “But if you do not believe his writings, how shall you believe My words?”

1.verse: After these things, Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is Tiberias.

2.verse: And a great multitude followed Him, because they saw His miracles which He did on those who were diseased.

3.verse: Then Jesus went up onto a mountain. And there He sat with His disciples.

4.verse: Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near.

5.verse: Then Jesus lifted up His eyes. And seeing that a great multitude came to Him, he said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread, so that these might eat?”

6.verse: (He said this to test him. For He knew what he would do.)

7.verse: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denari worth of bread is not sufficient for them, if every one of them takes a little.”

8.verse: Then Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, one of His disciples, said to Him,

9.verse: “There is a little boy here who has five barley loaves, and two fishes. But what are they among so many?”

10.verse: And Jesus said, “Make the men sit down. (Now there was much grass in that place.) Then the men sat down, about five thousand in number.

11.verse: And Jesus took the bread, and gave thanks, and gave it to the disciples. And the disciples gave to those who were sitting down; and likewise of the fishes, as much as they wanted.

12.verse: And when they were satisfied, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the broken pieces which remain, so that nothing is lost.”

13.verse: Then they gathered it up and filled twelve baskets with the broken pieces of the five barley loaves, which remained from those who had eaten.

14.verse: Then the men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, “This is truly the Prophet Who is to come into the world.”

15.verse: Therefore, when Jesus perceived that they would come and take Him to make him a king, He departed again into a mountain by Himself.

16.verse: When evening came, His disciples went down to the sea,

17.verse: and entered into a ship and went over the sea towards Capernaum. And now it was dark, and Jesus had not come to them.

18.verse: And the sea arose with a great wind that blew.

19.verse: And when they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty furlongs, they saw Jesus, walking on the sea and drawing near to the ship. So, they were afraid.

20.verse: But He said to them, “It is Me! Do not be afraid!”

21.verse: Then, willingly, they received Him into the ship. And immediately the ship arrived at the land where they were going.

22.verse: The following day, the people who stood on the other side of the sea, saw that there was no other ship there except the one His disciples had entered. And they saw that Jesus had not gone into the ship with His disciples, but that His disciples had gone alone,

23.verse: and that other ships had come from Tiberias near the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

24.verse: Now when the people saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they also took ships and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

25.verse: And when they had found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You come here?”

26.verse: Jesus answered them, and said, “Truly, truly I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw the miracles, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.

27.verse: “Do not labor for the food which perishes, but for the food that endures to everlasting life, which the Son of Man shall give to you. For God the Father has sealed Him.”

28.verse: Then they said to Him, “What shall we do so that we might work the works of God?”

29.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, “This is the work of God: that you believe in Him Whom He has sent.”

30.verse: Therefore they said to Him, “What sign do you show us, then, so that we may see it and believe You? What work do You do?

31.verse: “Our fathers ate Manna in the desert. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread from Heaven to eat.’”

32.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from Heaven. But My Father gives you the true bread from Heaven.

33.verse: “For the bread of God is He who comes down from Heaven and gives life to the world.”

34.verse: Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread at all times.”

35.verse: And Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. The one who comes to Me shall not hunger, and the one who believes in Me shall never thirst.

36.verse: “But I said to you that you have also seen Me, and do not believe.

37.verse: “All that the Father gives me, shall come to me. And the one who comes to me, I shall not cast away.

38.verse: “For I came down from Heaven, not to do My own will, but His will Who has sent Me.

39.verse: “And this is the Father’s will (Who has sent Me): that of all which He has given Me, I should lose nothing; but should raise it up again at the last day.

40.verse: “And this is the will of Him Who sent Me: that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in Him, should have everlasting life. And I will raise him up at the last day.”

41.verse: The Jews then grumbled at Him because He said, ‘I am the bread which has come down from Heaven.’

42.verse: And they said, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, Whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, “I came down from Heaven?”

43.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said to them, “Do not grumble among yourselves.

44.verse: “No one can come to Me unless the Father, Who has sent Me, draws him. And I will raise him up at the last day.

45.verse: “It is written in the Prophets, ‘And they shall all be taught by God’. Therefore, everyone who has heard, and has learned from the Father, comes to Me.

46.verse: “Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He Who is from God; He has seen the Father.

47.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, the one who believes in Me has everlasting life.

49.verse: “Your fathers ate Manna in the wilderness and are dead.

50.verse: “This is the bread which comes down from Heaven, so that anyone who eats of it should not die.

51.verse: “I am the living bread which came down from Heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he shall live forever. And the bread that I will give is My flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.”

52.verse: Then the Jews argued among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”

53.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man, and drink His blood, you have no life in you.

54.verse: “Whoever eats My flesh, and drinks My blood, has eternal life. And I will raise him up at the last day.

55.verse: “For My flesh is true food, and My blood is true drink.

56.verse: “the one who eats My flesh, and drinks My blood, dwells in Me, and I in him.

57.verse: “As the living Father has sent Me, so I live by the Father. And the one who feeds on Me, shall also live because of Me.

58.verse: “This is the bread which came down from Heaven; not as your fathers have eaten Manna and are dead. The one who eats of this bread, shall live forever.”

59.verse: These things He spoke in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.

60.verse: Therefore, many of His disciples (when they heard this) said, “This is a hard saying. Who can hear it?”

61.verse: But Jesus, knowing in Himself that His disciples grumbled at this, said to them, “Does this offend you?

62.verse: “What if, then, you should see the Son of Man ascend up where He was before?

63.verse: “It is the Spirit that quickens. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are Spirit and life.

64.verse: “But there are some of you who do not believe.” (For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would betray Him).

65.verse: And He said, “Therefore I said to you that no one can come to Me unless it is granted to him by My Father.”

66.verse: From that time, many of His disciples went back, and walked no more with Him.

67.verse: Then Jesus said to the twelve, “Will you also go away?”

68.verse: Then Simon Peter answered Him, “Master, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.

69.verse: “And we believe and know that You are the Christ, the Son of the Living God.”

70.verse: Jesus answered them, “Have I not chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?”

71.verse: Now He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon. For it was he who would betray Him, though he was one of the twelve.

1.verse: After these things, Jesus walked in Galilee. For He did not wish to walk in Judea because the Jews sought to kill Him.

2.verse: Now the Jews’ feast of the Tabernacles was at hand.

3.verse: Therefore, His brothers said to Him, “Leave here, and go into Judea, so that Your disciples may see Your works that You do.

4.verse: “For no one does anything secretly when seeking to be famous. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world.”

5.verse: For, as yet, His brothers did not believe in Him.

6.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come. But your time is always ready.

7.verse: “The world cannot hate you. But it hates Me, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.

8.verse: “You go up to the feast. I will not go up to this feast yet. For My time is not yet fulfilled.”

9.verse: He said these things to them and remained in Galilee.

10.verse: But as soon as His brothers had gone up, then He also went up to the feast; not openly, but, as it were, privately.

11.verse: Then the Jews sought Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”

12.verse: And there was much murmuring about Him among the people. Some said, “He is a good Man.” Others said, “No! But He deceives the people!”

13.verse: However, no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.

14.verse: Now, when half the feast was done, Jesus went up into the Temple and taught.

15.verse: And the Jews marveled, saying, “How does this Man know the Scriptures, seeing that He never learned!?”

16.verse: Jesus answered them, and said, “My doctrine is not Mine, but His who sent Me.

17.verse: “If anyone will do His will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be from God, or whether I speak from Myself.

18.verse: “Whoever speaks from himself, seeks his own glory. But whoever seeks the glory of the One who sent him, he is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

19.verse: “Did not Moses give you a Law, and yet none of you keeps the Law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”

20.verse: The people answered, and said, “You have a demon! Who seeks to kill You?”

21.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, “I have done one work, and you all marvel.

22.verse: “Therefore, Moses gave circumcision to you - not because it is of Moses, but of the Fathers - and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.

23.verse: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath so that the Law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry with Me because I have made a man entirely whole on the Sabbath?

24.verse: “Do not judge according to the appearance. But, judge righteous judgment.”

25.verse: Then some of them of Jerusalem said, “Is this not He Whom they seek to kill?

26.verse: “And behold, He speaks openly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers really know that this is truly the Christ?

27.verse: “However, we know from where this Man is. But when the Christ comes, no one shall know from where He is.”

28.verse: Then Jesus cried in the Temple as He taught, saying, “You both know Me and know from where I am. Yet I have not come of Myself. And He who sent Me is true (Whom you do not know).

29.verse: “But I know Him. For I am of Him, and He has sent Me.”

30.verse: Then they sought to take Him, but no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come.

31.verse: Now many of the people believed in Him, and said, “When the Christ comes, will He do any more miracles than this Man has done?”

32.verse: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured these things about Him. And the Pharisees, and chief priests, sent officers to take Him.

33.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “I am still with you a little while, and then I go to the One who sent Me.

34.verse: “You shall seek Me and shall not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come.”

35.verse: Then the Jews said among themselves, “Where will He go, that we shall not find Him? Will He go to those who are dispersed among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?

36.verse: “What saying is this that He said, ‘You shall seek Me, and shall not find Me’? And, ‘Where I am, you cannot come’?”

37.verse: Now, on the last day (the great day) of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, “If anyone thirsts, let him come to Me and drink.

38.verse: “The one who believes in Me, as says the Scripture, ‘Out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water’.”

39.verse: (He spoke this about the Spirit, Whom those who believed in Him were about to receive. For the Holy Ghost was not yet given because Jesus was not yet glorified.)

40.verse: So, many of the people, when they heard this saying, said, “Truly this is the Prophet.”

41.verse: Others said, “This is the Christ.” And some said, “But shall the Christ come out of Galilee?

42.verse: “Does not the Scripture say that the Christ shall come from the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?

43.verse: So there was dissension among the people because of Him.

44.verse: And some of them would have taken Him, but no one laid hands on Him.

45.verse: Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why have you not brought Him?”

46.verse: The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like this Man speaks.”

47.verse: Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived?

48.verse: “Do any of the rulers, or any of the Pharisees, believe in Him?

49.verse: “But this people, who do not know the Law, are cursed.”

50.verse: Nicodemus said to them (he who came to Jesus by night, and was one of them),

51.verse: “Does our Law judge a man before it hears him, and knows what he has done?”

52.verse: They answered, and said to him, “Aren’t you also from Galilee? Search and see that no Prophet arises out of Galilee.

53.verse: And each went to his own house.

1.verse: But, Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

2.verse: And early in the morning, He came into the Temple again. And all the people came to Him. And He sat down and taught them.

3.verse: Then the scribes and the Pharisees brought to Him a woman taken in adultery. And setting her in their midst,

4.verse: they said to Him, “Master, we found this woman committing adultery, even in the very act.

5.verse: “Now Moses, in our Law, commanded that such should be stoned. What do You say, therefore?”

6.verse: Now they said this to tempt Him, so that they might have something of which to accuse Him. But Jesus, having stooped down, wrote on the ground with His finger.

7.verse: And while they continued asking Him, He lifted Himself up, and said to them, “Let the one among you without sin cast the first stone at her.”

8.verse: And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.

9.verse: And when they heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, they went out, one by one, beginning at the eldest, until the last. And Jesus was left alone, with the woman, standing in the midst.

10.verse: When Jesus had lifted Himself up again, and saw no one except the woman, He said to her, “Woman, where are your accusers? Has no one condemned you?”

11.verse: She said, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “Nor do I condemn you. Go and sin no more.”

12.verse: Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, “I am the light of the world. The one who follows Me shall not walk in darkness but shall have the light of life.”

13.verse: Therefore, the Pharisees said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself. Your record is not true.”

14.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, “Even though I bear witness of Myself, My record is true. For I know from where I come, and to where I go. But you cannot tell from where I came, and to where I go.

15.verse: “You judge after the flesh. I judge no one.

16.verse: “If, however, I do judge, My judgment is true. For I am not alone, but I and the Father who sent Me.

17.verse: “And it is also written in your Law that the testimony of two men is true.

18.verse: “I am one who bears witness of Myself. And the Father, who sent Me, bears witness of Me.”

19.verse: Then they said to Him, “Where is this Father of yours?” Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also.

20.verse: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as He taught in the Temple. And no one laid hands on Him. For His hour had not yet come.

21.verse: Then Jesus said again to them, “I go My way. And you shall seek Me and shall die in your sins. Where I go, you cannot come.”

22.verse: Then said the Jews, “Will He kill himself? Because, He says, ‘Where I go, you cannot come’?”

23.verse: And He said to them, “You are from beneath. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.

24.verse: “Therefore I said to you that you shall die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am He, you shall die in your sins.”

25.verse: Then they said to Him, “Who are you?” And Jesus said to them, “Still the same that I said to you from the beginning.

26.verse: “I have many things to say and to judge concerning you. But the One who sent Me is true. And the things that I have heard from Him, those I speak to the world.”

27.verse: They did not understand what He spoke to them about the Father.

28.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you shall know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself. But as My Father has taught Me, I spoke these things.

29.verse: “For He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, because I always do those things that please Him.”

30.verse: As He spoke these things, many believed in Him.

31.verse: Then Jesus said to the Jews who believed in Him, “If you continue in My word, you are truly My disciples.

32.verse: “And you shall know the truth. And the truth shall make you free.”

33.verse: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s seed, and were never slave to anyone. Why then do You say, ‘You shall be made free’?”

34.verse: Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly I say to you that whoever commits sin is the servant of sin.

35.verse: “And the servant does not abide in the house forever. But the Son abides forever.

36.verse: “If, therefore, the Son shall make you free, you shall be free indeed.

37.verse: “I know that you are Abraham’s seed. But you seek to kill Me because My word has no place in you.

38.verse: “I speak that which I have seen with My Father. And you do that which you have seen with your father.”

39.verse: They answered, and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.

40.verse: “But now you seek to kill Me, a man who has told you the truth, which I have heard from God. Abraham did not do this.

41.verse: “You do the works of your father.” Then they said to Him, “We are not born of fornication. We have one Father, who is God.”

42.verse: Therefore Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, then you would love Me. For I proceeded forth and came from God. I did not even come of Myself, but He sent Me.

43.verse: “Why do you not understand My talk? Because you cannot hear My word.

44.verse: “You are of your father, the devil. And you will do the lusts of your father. He has been a murderer from the beginning, and did not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, then he speaks of his own. For he is a liar and the father thereof.

45.verse: “And because I tell you the truth, you do not believe Me.

46.verse: “Which of you can rebuke Me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do you not believe Me?

47.verse: “The one who is of God hears God’s words. You, therefore, do not hear them, because you are not of God.”

48.verse: Then the Jews answered, and said to Him, “Are we not correct in saying that You are a Samaritan, and have a devil?”

49.verse: Jesus answered, “I have no devil. But I honor My Father. And you have dishonored Me.

50.verse: “And I do not seek My own praise. But there is One who seeks it, and judges.

51.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, “If anyone keeps My word, he shall never see death.”

52.verse: Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a devil. Abraham is dead, and the Prophets, and You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word, he shall never taste of death.

53.verse: “Are You greater than our father, Abraham, who is dead?! And the Prophets are dead! Who do You think You are!?”

54.verse: Jesus answered, “If I honor Myself, My honor is worth nothing. It is My Father Who honors Me; the One you say is your God.

55.verse: “Yet you have not known Him. But I know Him. And if I should say I do not know Him, I would be a liar, like you. But I know Him and keep His word.

56.verse: “Your father, Abraham, rejoiced to see My day. And he saw it and was glad.”

57.verse: Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and You have seen Abraham?”

58.verse: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you: Before Abraham was, I am.”

59.verse: Then they took up stones to throw at Him. But Jesus hid Himself and went out of the Temple. And He passed through the midst of them, and so went His way.

1.verse: And as Jesus passed by, He saw a man who was blind from his birth.

2.verse: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Master, who sinned - this man, or his parents - that he was born blind?”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents have sinned. But this is so that the works of God would be shown in him.

4.verse: “I must work the works of the One who sent Me, while it is day. The night comes, when no one can work.

5.verse: “As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”

6.verse: As soon as He had thus spoken, He spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and anointed the eyes of the blind with the clay.

7.verse: And He said to him, “Go. Wash in the pool of Siloam (which is by interpretation, Sent).” Therefore, he went and washed, and came back seeing.

8.verse: Now, the neighbors, and those who had seen him before, when he was blind, said, “Is not this he who sat and begged?”

9.verse: Some said, “This is he.” And others said, “He is like him.” But he himself said, “I am he!”

10.verse: Therefore they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”

11.verse: He answered, and said, “The Man who is called ‘Jesus’ made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash’. So, I went and washed, and received sight.”

12.verse: Then they said to him, “Where is he?” He said, “I cannot tell.”

13.verse: They brought him who was once blind to the Pharisees.

14.verse: And it was the Sabbath when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.

15.verse: Then, again, the Pharisees also asked him how he had received sight. And he said to them, “He laid clay upon my eyes. And I washed. And now I see.”

16.verse: Then some of the Pharisees said, “This Man is not of God, because He does not keep the Sabbath.” Others said, “How can a Man who is a sinner do such miracles?” And there was a dissension among them.

17.verse: Then they spoke to the blind again, “What do you say about Him, since He has opened your eyes?” And he said, “He is a Prophet.”

18.verse: Then the Jews did not believe him (that he had been blind and received his sight) until they had called the parents of him who had received sight.

19.verse: And they asked them, saying, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How, then, does he now see?”

20.verse: His parents answered them, and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind.

21.verse: “But by what means he now sees we do not know. Or, who has opened his eyes we cannot tell. He is old enough. Ask him. He shall answer for himself.”

22.verse: His parents spoke these words because they feared the Jews. For the Jews had already ordained that if anyone confessed that he was Christ, he would be expelled from the synagogue.

23.verse: That is why his parents said, ‘He is old enough. Ask him.’

24.verse: Then again they called the man who had been blind, and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this Man is a sinner.”

25.verse: Then he answered, and said, “Whether He is a sinner or not, I cannot tell. One thing I know: that I was blind, and now I see!”

26.verse: Then they said to him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”

27.verse: He answered them, “I have told you already, and you have not heard it. Why would you hear it again? Do you also wish to be His disciples?

28.verse: Then they reviled him, and said, “You be His disciple! We will be Moses’ disciples!

29.verse: “We know that God spoke with Moses. But we do not know from where this Man is.”

30.verse: The man answered, and said to them, “Doubtless, this is a wondrous thing; that you do not know from where He is, and yet He has opened my eyes.

31.verse: “Now we know that God does not hear sinners. But if anyone is a worshiper of God, and does His will, He does hear him.

32.verse: “Since the world began it has been unheard of for anyone to open the eyes of one born blind.

33.verse: “If this Man were not of God, He could have done nothing.”

34.verse: “They answered, and said to him, “You were born entirely in sin, and do you teach us?” So, they cast him out.

35.verse: Jesus heard that they had cast him out. And when He had found him, He said to him, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”

36.verse: He answered, and said, “Who is He, Lord, that I might believe in Him?”

37.verse: And Jesus said to him, “You have both seen Him, and it is He who is talking with you.”

38.verse: Then he said, “Lord, I believe!” and worshiped Him.

39.verse: And Jesus said, “For judgment I have come into this world, so that those who do not see, might see; and that those who see, might be made blind.”

40.verse: And some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these things, and said to Him, “Are we blind also?”

41.verse: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin. But now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore, your sin remains.

1.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, the one who does not enter in by the door into the sheepfold, but climbs up another way, he is a thief and a robber.

2.verse: “But the one who goes in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.verse: “To him the doorkeeper opens. And the sheep hear his voice. And he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

4.verse: “And when he has sent forth his own sheep, he goes before them. And the sheep follow him. For they know his voice.

5.verse: “And they will not follow a stranger. But they flee from him. For they do not know the voice of strangers.”

6.verse: Jesus spoke this parable to them. But they did not understand what it was he was saying to them.

7.verse: Then Jesus said to them again, “Truly, truly I say to you, I am that Door of the sheep.

8.verse: “All that ever came before Me are thieves and robbers. But the sheep did not hear them.

9.verse: “I am that Door. If anyone enters in by Me, he shall be saved, and shall go in, and go out, and find pasture.

10.verse: “The thief comes not, if not to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they might have life and have it in abundance.

11.verse: “I am the Good Shepherd. The Good Shepherd gives His life for His sheep.

12.verse: “But the hired servant (who is not the shepherd, nor are the sheep his own) sees the wolf coming and he leaves the sheep and flees. And the wolf catches them and scatters the sheep.

13.verse: “So the hired servant flees because he is a hired servant and does not care for the sheep.

14.verse: “I am the Good Shepherd, and know My own, and am known by My own.

15.verse: “As the Father knows Me, so I know the Father. And I lay down My life for the sheep.

16.verse: “I have other sheep also, which are not of this fold. I must also bring them. And they shall hear My voice. And there shall be one sheepfold, with one Shepherd.

17.verse: “Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life, that I might take it again.

18.verse: “No one takes it from Me. But I lay it down on My own. I have authority to lay it down and have authority to take it again. I have received this commandment from My Father.”

19.verse: Again, there was a dissension among the Jews because of these sayings.

20.verse: And many of them said, ‘He has a demon, and is insane. Why listen to Him?’

21.verse: Others said, ‘These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?’

22.verse: And at Jerusalem was the Feast of the Dedication. And it was winter.

23.verse: And Jesus walked in the Temple, in Solomon’s porch.

24.verse: Then the Jews came around Him, and said to Him, “How long will You hold us in suspense? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

25.verse: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you did not believe it. The works that I do in My Father’s Name, they bear witness of Me.

26.verse: “But you did not believe it. For you are not of My sheep, as I said to you.

27.verse: “My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.

28.verse: “And I give them eternal life. And they shall never perish, nor shall anyone snatch them out of My hand.

29.verse: “My Father, Who gave them to Me, is greater than all. And no one is able to snatch them out of My Father’s hand.

31.verse: Then the Jews took up stones again, to stone Him.

32.verse: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from My Father. For which of these works do you stone Me?”

33.verse: The Jews answered Him, saying, “We do not stone You for a good work, but for blasphemy; and that you, being a Man, make Yourself God.

34.verse: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your Law, ‘I said, you are gods’?

35.verse: “If he called them gods (to whom the word of God has come) and the Scripture cannot be broken,

36.verse: do you say of Him Whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme’, because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?

37.verse: “If I do not do the works of My Father, do not believe Me.

38.verse: “But if I do, then even though you do not believe Me, believe the works; so that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”

39.verse: Again they sought to take Him. But He escaped out of their hands.

40.verse: And again He went beyond Jordan, into the place where John first baptized, and stayed there.

41.verse: And many came to Him, and said, “John did no miracle. But all things that John spoke about this Man were true.”

42.verse: And many believed in Him there.

1.verse: And a certain man was sick - Lazarus of Bethany (the town of Mary and her sister Martha).

2.verse: And this was that same Mary who anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.

3.verse: Therefore, the sisters sent to Him, saying, “Lord, behold, he whom You love is sick.”

4.verse: When Jesus heard it, He said, “This sickness does not end in death, but is for the glory of God, so that the Son of God might be glorified by it.”

5.verse: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

6.verse: And after He had heard that he was sick, He still stayed two days in the same place where He was.

7.verse: Then after that, He said to His disciples, “Let us go into Judea again.”

8.verse: The disciples said to Him, “Master, the Jews sought to stone You recently, and yet You go there again?”

9.verse: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If someone walks in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.

10.verse: “But if someone walks in the night, he stumbles, because there is no light in him.”

11.verse: He spoke these things. And afterward, He said to them, “Our friend Lazarus sleeps. But I go to wake him up.”

12.verse: Then His disciples said, “Lord, if he sleeps, he shall heal.”

13.verse: However, Jesus spoke of his death. But they thought that He had spoken of the natural sleep.

14.verse: Then Jesus said to them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.

15.verse: “And I am glad, for your sakes, that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”

16.verse: Then said Thomas (who is called Didymus) to his fellow disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with Him.”

17.verse: Then Jesus came and found that he had already been in the grave four days.

18.verse: (Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about two miles away.)

19.verse: And many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary to comfort them for their brother.

20.verse: Then Martha, when she heard that Jesus was coming, went to meet Him. But Mary still sat in the house.

21.verse: Then Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.

22.verse: “But now, I also know that whatever you ask of God, God will give you.”

23.verse: Jesus said to her, “Your brother shall rise again.”

24.verse: “Martha said to Him, “I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection, at the last day.”

25.verse: Jesus said to her, “I am the Resurrection and the Life. Whoever believes in Me, though he were dead, yet shall he live.

26.verse: “And whoever lives, and believes in Me, shall never die. Do you believe this?”

27.verse: She said to Him, “Yes, Lord. I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, the One coming into the world.”

28.verse: And when she had said this, she went her way, and secretly called Mary, her sister, saying, “The Master has come, and calls for you.”

29.verse: And when she heard it, she arose quickly, and came to Him.

30.verse: For Jesus had not yet come into the town but was in the place where Martha met Him.

31.verse: Then the Jews who were with her in the house and comforted her, when they saw Mary (that she rose up hastily and went out) followed her, saying, “She goes to the grave, to weep there.”

32.verse: Then, when Mary had come to where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”

33.verse: Therefore, when Jesus saw her weep (and also the Jews who came with her weep), He groaned in the spirit and was troubled in Himself,

34.verse: and said, “Where have you laid him?” They said to Him, “Lord, come and see.”

36.verse: Then the Jews said, “Behold, how He loved him.”

37.verse: And some of them said, “Could not He, who opened the eyes of the blind, have also made it so that this man should not have died?”

38.verse: Therefore Jesus groaned in Himself again and came to the grave. And it was a cave. And a stone was laid upon it.

39.verse: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, “Lord, he stinks already. For it has been four days.”

40.verse: Jesus said to her, “Did I not say to you that if you believed, you would see the glory of God?”

41.verse: Then they took away the stone where the dead was laid. And Jesus lifted up His eyes, and said, “Father, I thank You, because You have heard Me.

42.verse: “I know that You always hear Me. But I said it because of the people who stand by, so that they may believe that You have sent Me.”

43.verse: And having spoken these things, He cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus! Come forth!”

44.verse: Then, the one who was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with bandages. And his face was bound with a handkerchief. Jesus said to them, “Unbind him! And let him go!”

45.verse: Then many of the Jews who came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed in Him.

46.verse: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what things Jesus had done.

47.verse: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, “What shall we do? For this Man does many miracles.

48.verse: “If we let Him alone like this, all will believe in Him. And the Romans will come and take away both our place and the nation.

49.verse: Then one of them, Caiaphas, who was the High Priest that same year, said to them, “You perceive nothing at all.

50.verse: Nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one Man die for the people, and that the whole nation not perish.

51.verse: He spoke this, not of himself, but being High Priest that same year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation;

52.verse: and not only for the nation, but that He would gather together the children of God who were scattered.

53.verse: Then, from that day forth, they plotted to put Him to death.

54.verse: Therefore Jesus walked openly no more among the Jews; but went from there to a country near the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and stayed there with His disciples.

55.verse: And the Jews’ Passover was at hand. And many went out of the country before the Passover, up to Jerusalem, to purify themselves.

56.verse: Then they sought for Jesus, and spoke among themselves as they stood in the Temple, “What do you think - that He will not come to the Feast?

57.verse: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment that if anyone knew where He was, he should make it known, so that they might take Him.

1.verse: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was; who had died and whom He had raised from the dead.

2.verse: There they made Him a supper, and Martha served. But Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.

3.verse: Then Mary took a pound of ointment of Spikenard (very costly) and anointed Jesus’ feet, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.

4.verse: Then one of His disciples who would betray him, Judas Iscariot (son of Simon) said,

5.verse: “Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred denari and given to the poor?”

6.verse: Now, he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and held that which was given.

7.verse: Then Jesus said, “Let her alone. She kept it for the day of My burying.

8.verse: “For the poor you have with you always. But Me you shall not have always.”

9.verse: Then many of the Jews knew that He was there. And they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom He had raised from the dead.

10.verse: Therefore, the chief priests consulted, so that they might put Lazarus to death also,

11.verse: because many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus because of him.

12.verse: The next day, a great multitude who had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus would come to Jerusalem,

13.verse: took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet Him, and cried, “Hosanna! Blessed is the King of Israel Who comes in the Name of the Lord!”

14.verse: And Jesus found a young donkey, and sat on it, as it is written,

15.verse: “Fear not, daughter of Zion. Behold, your King comes, sitting on a donkey’s colt.”

16.verse: His disciples did not understand these things at the first. But when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written of Him. And that they had done these things to Him.

17.verse: Therefore, the people who were with Him bore witness that He called Lazarus out of the grave and raised him from the dead.

18.verse: Thus, the people also met Him, because they heard that He had done this miracle.

19.verse: And the Pharisees said among themselves, “Do you see how nothing is better? Behold, the world goes after Him.”

20.verse: Now, there were certain Greeks among them who came up to worship at the Feast.

21.verse: And they came to Philip, who was of Bethsaida in Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we would like to see Jesus.”

22.verse: Philip came and told Andrew. And then Andrew and Philip came and told Jesus.

23.verse: And Jesus answered them, saying, “The hour has come that the Son of Man must be glorified.

24.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, unless the grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone. But if it dies, it brings forth much fruit.

25.verse: “The one who loves his life, shall lose it. And the one who hates his life in this world, shall keep it to life eternal.

26.verse: “If anyone serves Me, let him follow Me. For where I am, there My servant shall be. And if anyone serves Me, My father will honor him.

27.verse: Now My soul is troubled. And what shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? But, for this I came to this hour.

28.verse: “Father, glorify Your Name.” Then, there came a Voice from Heaven, “I have both glorified it and will glorify it again.”

29.verse: Then, the people who stood by and heard it said that it was thunder. Others said an angel spoke to Him.

30.verse: Jesus answered, and said, “This Voice did not come because of Me, but for your sakes.

31.verse: “Now is the judgment of this world. Now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

32.verse: “And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all to Myself.

33.verse: Now He said this to signify what death He would die.

34.verse: The people answered Him, “We have heard out of the Law that the Christ abides forever. So how can You say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is the Son of Man?”

35.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “The Light is with you for a little while longer. Walk while you have the Light, lest the darkness come upon you. For one who walks in the dark, does not know where he goes.

36.verse: “While you have the Light, believe in the Light, that you may be the children of the Light.” These things Jesus spoke. And having departed, He hid Himself from them.

37.verse: And though He had done so many miracles before them, they did not believe in Him,

38.verse: so that the saying of Isaiah the Prophet might be fulfilled, that said, ‘Lord, who believed our report? And to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?’

39.verse: Therefore they could not believe, because Isaiah says again,

40.verse: ‘He has blinded their eyes and hardened their heart, so that they would not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I heal them.’

41.verse: These things Isaiah said when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.

42.verse: Nevertheless, even among the chief rulers, many believed in Him. But because of the Pharisees, they did not confess Him, lest they should be cast out of the synagogue.

43.verse: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.

44.verse: And Jesus cried, and said, “Whoever believes in Me, believes not in Me, but in Him who sent Me!

45.verse: “And whoever sees Me, sees Him who sent Me!

46.verse: “I have come, a Light into the world, so that everyone who believes in Me would not stay in darkness.

47.verse: “And if anyone hears My words, and does not believe, I do not judge him. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.

48.verse: “Whoever refuses Me, and does not receive My words, has One Who judges him - the Word that I have spoken. It shall judge him on the last day.

49.verse: “For I have not spoken of Myself, but the Father Who sent Me. He gave Me a commandment, what I should say and what I should speak.

50.verse: “And I know that His commandment is life everlasting. Therefore, the things that I speak, I speak just as the Father said to Me.”

1.verse: Now, before the Feast of the Passover, when Jesus knew that His hour had come (that He would depart out of this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world) He loved them to the end.

2.verse: And when supper was done (and the devil had now put in the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray Him),

3.verse: Jesus - knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come forth from God and went to God -

4.verse: He rose from supper and laid aside His garments and took a towel and wrapped Himself.

5.verse: After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel in which He was wrapped.

6.verse: Then He came to Simon Peter, who said to Him, “Lord, You wash my feet?”

7.verse: Jesus answered and said to him, “What I do, you do not know now. But you shall know it hereafter.”

8.verse: Peter said to Him, “You shall never wash my feet.” Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you shall have no part with Me.”

9.verse: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also the hands and the head.”

10.verse: Jesus said to him, “He who is washed, needs only to wash his feet, but is wholly clean. And you are clean, but not all.”

11.verse: For He knew who would betray Him. Therefore, He said, ‘You are not all clean’.

12.verse: So, after He had washed their feet and had taken His garments and had sat down again, He said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?

13.verse: “You call Me Master, and Lord. And you say well. For so I am.

14.verse: “If I, then, your Lord and Master, has washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.

15.verse: “For I have given you an example, so that you should do just as I have done to you.

16.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, the servant is not greater than his master, nor the messenger greater than the one who sent him.

17.verse: “If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.

18.verse: “I do not speak of you all. I know whom I have chosen. But it is so that the Scripture might be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with Me has lifted up his heel against Me.’

19.verse: “From now on I tell you before it comes, so that when it has happened, you might believe that I am He.

20.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, anyone who receives whom I shall send, receives Me; and anyone who receives Me, receives Him Who sent Me.”

21.verse: When Jesus had said these things, He was troubled in Spirit, and testified, and said, “Truly, truly I say to you, that one of you shall betray Me.”

22.verse: Then the disciples looked at one another, uncertain of whom He spoke.

23.verse: Now, there was one of His disciples, who leaned on Jesus’ bosom, whom Jesus loved.

24.verse: Therefore, Simon Peter motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke.

25.verse: Then, as he leaned on Jesus’ breast, he said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”

26.verse: Jesus answered, “It is him to whom I shall give a morsel, when I have dipped it.” And He wet a morsel of bread, and gave it to Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son.

27.verse: And after the morsel, Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said to him, “That you do, do quickly.”

28.verse: But none of them who were at table knew why He said this to him.

29.verse: For some of them thought Jesus had said that to him because Judas had the bag to buy those things we need for the feast, or that he should give something to the poor.

30.verse: Then, as soon as he had received the morsel, he immediately went out. And it was night.

31.verse: When he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now is the Son of Man glorified, and God is glorified in Him.

32.verse: “If God is glorified in Him, God shall also glorify Him in Himself, and shall immediately glorify Him.

33.verse: “Little children, I am still with you a little while longer. You shall seek Me, but as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I go, you cannot come’, so also I say to you now.

34.verse: “A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also love one another.

35.verse: “By this shall all know that you are My disciples - if you have love one to another.”

36.verse: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered him, “Where I go you cannot follow Me now. But you shall follow Me afterward.”

37.verse: Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down My life for your sake!”

38.verse: Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for My sake? Truly, truly I say to you, the cock shall not crow till you have denied Me three times.”

1.verse: “Let not your heart be troubled. You believe in God, believe also in Me.

2.verse: “In My Father’s house are many dwelling places. If it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.

3.verse: “And if I go to prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you to Myself; that where I am, there may you be also.

4.verse: “And where I go, you know; and the way you know.”

5.verse: Thomas said to Him, “Lord, we don’t know where You’re going. How, then, can we know the way?”

6.verse: Jesus said to him, “I am the Way, and the Truth, and the Life. No one comes to the Father, if not by Me.

7.verse: “If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also. And henceforth, you know Him, and have seen Him.”

8.verse: Philip said to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it will satisfy us.”

9.verse: Jesus said to him, “I have been with you such a long time, and have you not known Me, Philip? Whoever has seen Me, has seen the Father. How then can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?”

10.verse: “Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father is in Me? The words that I speak to you, I speak not of Myself. But the Father who dwells in Me, He does the works.

11.verse: “Believe Me, that I am in the Father, and the Father is in Me. At the least, believe Me for the very works’ sake.

12.verse: “Truly, truly I say to you, whoever believes in Me, the works that I do, he shall do also, and greater than these shall he do. For I go to My Father.

13.verse: “And whatever you ask in My Name, that will I do; so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

14.verse: “If you shall ask anything in My Name, I will do it.

15.verse: “If you love Me, keep My commandments.

16.verse: “And I will ask the Father, and He shall give you another Comforter, that He may be with you forever;

17.verse: the Spirit of Truth, Whom the world cannot receive because it neither sees Him nor knows Him. But you know Him. For He dwells with you and shall be in you.

18.verse: “I will not leave you fatherless. I will come to you.

19.verse: “Yet a little while, and the world shall see Me no more. But you shall see Me. Because I live, you shall live also.

20.verse: “At that day shall you know that I am in My Father; and you in Me; and I in you.

21.verse: Whoever has My commandments, and keeps them, is he who loves Me. And whoever loves Me, shall be loved by My Father. And I will love him and will show Myself to him.”

22.verse: Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, why do You show Yourself to us, and not to the world?”

23.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, “If anyone loves Me, he will keep My word. And My Father will love him. And We will come to him and will dwell with him.

24.verse: “Whoever does not love Me, does not keep My words. And the word which you hear is not Mine, but the Father’s, Who sent Me.

25.verse: “These things I have spoken to you, being present with you.

26.verse: “But the Comforter (Who is the Holy Ghost, Whom the Father will send in My Name) He shall teach you all things and bring all things to your remembrance which I have told you.

27.verse: “Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, nor fear.

28.verse: “You have heard how I said to you, ‘I go away, and will come to you’. If you loved Me, you would truly rejoice, because I said, ‘I go to the Father’, for the Father is greater than Me.

29.verse: “And now have I spoken to you before it comes, so that when it has come to pass you might believe.

30.verse: “I will no longer speak many things to you. For the prince of this world comes, and has nothing in Me,

31.verse: “But that the world may know that I love my Father. And as the Father has commanded Me, so I do. Arise, let us go from here.”

1.verse: “I am the true Vine, and My Father is the Vinedresser.

2.verse: “Every branch that does not bear fruit in Me, He takes away. And every one that bears fruit, He prunes it, so that it may bring forth more fruit.

3.verse: “Now, you are clean, through the word which I have spoken to you.

4.verse: “Abide in Me, and I in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit of itself unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in Me.

5.verse: “I am the vine. You are the branches. Whoever abides in Me, and I in him, the same brings forth much fruit. For without Me, you can do nothing.

6.verse: “If one does not abide in Me, he is cast forth as a branch, and withers. And they are gathered up and cast into the fire, and they burn.

7.verse: “If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, ask what you will and it shall be done to you.

8.verse: “In this My Father is glorified, so that you bear much fruit and are made My disciples.

9.verse: “As the Father has loved Me, so have I loved you. Continue in My love.

10.verse: “If you shall keep My commandments, you shall abide in My love (as I have kept My Father’s commandments and abide in His love).

11.verse: “These things I have spoken to you, so that My joy might remain in you and that your joy might be full.

12.verse: “This is My commandment: that you love one another, as I have loved you.

13.verse: “No one has greater love than this: when he lays down his life for his friends.

14.verse: “You are my friends if you do whatever I command you.

15.verse: “I no longer call you servants. For the servant does not know what his master does. But I have called you friends. For all things that I have heard from My Father, I have made known to you.

16.verse: “You have not chosen Me. But I have chosen you, and ordained you, so that you go and bring forth fruits and that your fruit remains, so that whatever you shall ask of the Father in My Name, He may give it you.

17.verse: “These things I command you, so that you love one another.

18.verse: “If the world hates you, know that it hated Me before you.

19.verse: “If you were of the world, the world would love his own. But because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

20.verse: “Remember the word that I said to you, ‘the servant is not greater than his master’. If they have persecuted Me, they will persecute you also. If they have kept My word, they will also keep yours.

21.verse: “But all these things they will do to you for My Name’s sake, because they have not known Him who sent Me.

22.verse: “If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin. But now they have no cloak for their sin.

23.verse: “Whoever hates Me, hates My Father also.

24.verse: “If I had not done works among those whom no other did, they would not have sin. Now, however, they have both seen and hated both My Father and Me.

25.verse: But this is so the word which is written in their Law might be fulfilled, ‘They hated Me without a cause’.

26.verse: “But when that Comforter shall come, Whom I will send to you from the Father (even the Spirit of Truth, Who proceeds from the Father) He shall testify of Me.
